ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_rainbow] Mana regen
ygData.msgSnippet: All Thanks so much for the responses I recieved on this. I m not under any Bard song or such. I ve only my own level 19 or lower buffs for STR, etc. I ve got
ygData.messageBody:
All

Thanks so much for the responses I recieved on this.

I'm not under any Bard song or such. I've only my own level 19 or lower
buffs for STR, etc. I've got 88 WIS and 85 INT.

Actually what I notice is that sometimes when I meditate the mana goes up
very slow (I can go clean the house !) - - if I click the meditate button
off and then on again it will sometimes go up in larger increments. At this
point I think this may be a bug and I will report it.

It's really great seeing so much family on EQ !! If anyone is on Mith Marr
look me up - i'm usually hanging out in Oasis at the Pier or North Ro at the
Platform.

Klek - level 19 and holding !



-----Original Message-----
From: Lora Roa [mailto:loraroa@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 16, 2000 8:39 AM
To: EQ_rainbow@onelist.com
Subject: [EQ_rainbow] Mana regen


From: Lora Roa <loraroa@...>


I actually may have a clue too.

There has been a running debate on if the low level Bard song
for stamina helps mana regen. It brought out some interesting
side effects.

Many mages said they "saw" a difference, but EQ staff on the Bard
list eventually said it had no effect.

So the Bards fiddled with it a bit (pun intended).

It seems that many stamina buffs will cause the "ticker" to update
faster. BUT before you get excited, the total time it takes to
go from 1 bubble to full (in mana) does not vary, just the rate at
which the changes are displayed. The Bards found several mages
and asked them to time the total refill time as well as time the
"ticker" or visual update timer. They then tested with and w/o song.
The data fit both what the mages saw and the EQ staff info. The
"ticker" times could vary, fooling you into thinking it was filling faster,
but the refill total time was pretty constant. If a true mana regen spell
or
song was put in effect *then* the total refill time was indeed reduced.

So, were you under any stamina buffs? They can give an illusion.

- Lora
